title: How to Dismount from a Bicycle

steps.title: From the seated position, pedal on one side then lean forward to stand up on that pedal while lifting your butt off the seat.
steps.content: From the seated position, pedal on one side then lean forward to stand up on that pedal while lifting your butt off the seat. (This is the most important step. If you remain seated you will not have as much control over your bike once stopped.)

steps.title: Slow the bike almost to a stop, making sure to keep your balance.
steps.content: Slow the bike almost to a stop, making sure to keep your balance. Use your body, rather than the handlebars.

steps.title: Remove the higher foot from its pedal.
steps.content: Remove the higher foot from its pedal. [1] X Research source

steps.title: As the bike comes to a complete stop, tip your bicycle slightly to the side with the freed foot.
steps.content: As the bike comes to a complete stop, tip your bicycle slightly to the side with the freed foot.

steps.title: Put that foot on the ground.
steps.content: Put that foot on the ground.

steps.title: Remove the other foot from its pedal and put it on the ground.
steps.content: Remove the other foot from its pedal and put it on the ground.

steps.title: Lean the bike slightly as you swing either leg over the seat or through the frame if it's a female-style bicycle.
steps.content: Lean the bike slightly as you swing either leg over the seat or through the frame if it's a female-style bicycle. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Put your other foot on the ground.
steps.content: Put your other foot on the ground.

steps.title: As you are riding the bike, swing one leg over the frame and onto the other pedal quickly.
steps.content: As you are riding the bike, swing one leg over the frame and onto the other pedal quickly.

steps.title: In a swift motion, 'ditch' the bike and use the frame to vault forward.
steps.content: In a swift motion, 'ditch' the bike and use the frame to vault forward.

steps.title: Land safely and recover the bike.
steps.content: Land safely and recover the bike. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Build up some speed ahead of time.
steps.content: Build up some speed ahead of time.

steps.title: Start "coasting" (stop pedaling.
steps.content: Start "coasting" (stop pedaling. the bike still moves) when you are a few yards away from your destination.

steps.title: When you are just a few feet away, GENTLY squeeze your rear brake.
steps.content: When you are just a few feet away, GENTLY squeeze your rear brake. The bike should begin to skid.

steps.title: SLOWLY remove your feet from the pedals and firmly plant them on the ground BEFORE the bike stops moving.
steps.content: SLOWLY remove your feet from the pedals and firmly plant them on the ground BEFORE the bike stops moving. It should come to an early stop.

steps.title: Stand up.
steps.content: Stand up. Swing a foot over the bike and walk it up to an optimal location.

steps.title: Swing a foot (usually the right foot is used but either foot is acceptable) behind the back of your bicycle seat, while the bicycle is still in slight motion.
steps.content: Swing a foot (usually the right foot is used but either foot is acceptable) behind the back of your bicycle seat, while the bicycle is still in slight motion. Note: If you have toe clips, be very sure to disconnect your pedal foot from them! If you forget this, you will find yourself literally slammed on the ground when your "swing" foot touches the ground to stop! [4] X Research source

steps.title: Coast to a stop with both feet on one side of your bicycle, with one foot on the pedal and the other foot behind it.
steps.content: Coast to a stop with both feet on one side of your bicycle, with one foot on the pedal and the other foot behind it. Use your body rather than your steering to balance. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Once your bicycle is totally stopped, step onto the ground.
steps.content: Once your bicycle is totally stopped, step onto the ground.
